atom:link.href: As the world of the African diaspora undergoes a rapid evolution, rather than celebrating, promoting, critiquing, and documenting our progress in silos, we wanted to create a space to do it as one. We created The Nurubian to stay up to date with the happenings of our diaspora, and to take control of the narrative of our new story.

item.title: Remittances: Maximizing Their Impact on African Development, Aileen Waitaaga Kimuhu — The Nurubian
item.author: Nurubian

item.title: Pawns and Kings: Deconstructing Japan-Russia relations in Africa — The Nurubian
item.author: Nurubian
item.description: There is a growing demand for summits between Africa and select global powers. These summits often resemble a “summoning” rather than egalitarian partnerships aimed at bolstering sustainable economic development.
item.content:encoded: There is a growing demand for summits between Africa and select global powers. These summits often resemble a “summoning” rather than egalitarian partnerships aimed at bolstering sustainable economic development.

item.title: Building beneficial AI systems in Africa: Accelerating Data Availability, Kavengi Kitonga — The Nurubian
item.author: Nurubian
item.description: AI is gaining ground in Africa, but data limitations are a hurdle. To unlock AI’s potential, Africa needs policies for collaboration, AI expertise, and ethical data collection.
item.content:encoded: AI is gaining ground in Africa, but data limitations are a hurdle. To unlock AI’s potential, Africa needs policies for collaboration, AI expertise, and ethical data collection.

item.description: African countries are juggling climate commitments and economic growth challenges.

item.title: Resilience in Informality: Lessons From a Hidden Economy — The Nurubian
item.author: Nurubian
item.description: Africa’s informal sector is a vibrant and bustling space, filled with street vendors and food stalls that exude a unique energy. However, beneath the surface of this everyday hustle lies a remarkable tale of resilience that is deeply ingrained in the fabric of African history.
item.content:encoded: Africa’s informal sector is a vibrant and bustling space, filled with street vendors and food stalls that exude a unique energy. However, beneath the surface of this everyday hustle lies a remarkable tale of resilience that is deeply ingrained in the fabric of African history.

item.title: The Mama Mboga Economy — The Nurubian
item.author: Nurubian
item.description: Nairobi, one of Africa’s fastest developing centres, is home to many business organisations contributing to Kenya’s economic and social development. Rapidly experiencing an economic shift; Kenya heavily relies on the informal economic sector, with small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) being the

item.title: Precarious Women: a Glimpse Into the Lives of Nigerian Market Women — The Nurubian
item.author: Nurubian
item.description: On the Northside of the development divide, a trip to the market is a restful weekend activity. You might come across golden wicker baskets, untagged glass jars full of honey, and possibly a few different tables of locally sourced fruits and vegetables.
item.content:encoded: On the Northside of the development divide, a trip to the market is a restful weekend activity. You might come across golden wicker baskets, untagged glass jars full of honey, and possibly a few different tables of locally sourced fruits and vegetables.

item.title: Home (Copy) — The Nurubian
item.author: Nurubian
item.description: Our pride as a publication stems from a unique opportunity to utilize the diverse perspectives of over 3,000 tribes and 1.4 billion people in order to cultivate a myriad of thought. We do not aim to take sides, report on political ideologies, or inspire a narrow world view.
item.content:encoded: Our pride as a publication stems from a unique opportunity to utilize the diverse perspectives of over 3,000 tribes and 1.4 billion people in order to cultivate a myriad of thought. We do not aim to take sides, report on political ideologies, or inspire a narrow world view.
